titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania LJS 486: Kitāb al-Ghāz fī al-lughah al-ʻArabīyah

availability.licence: This description is ©2015 University of Pennsylvania Libraries. msContents.summary: Compilation of riddles drawn from early Islamic and pre-Islamic poetry, arranged in alphabetical order by their answers.

supportDesc.extent: 93 leaves : 280 x 180 (196 x 115) mm. bound to 280 x 184 mm

collation.p: Paper, 93; 1¹⁴ 2⁶ 3¹⁴ 4⁶ 5¹⁴ 6⁶ 7¹⁴ 8⁶ 9¹⁴(-1); [1-93], modern foliation in pencil, upper left recto.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in up to 29 long lines. Catchwords on each leaf, lower left verso.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in naskh script, with headings in a larger script.

decoDesc.decoNote: Some headings and a few small decorative elements accompanying headings in red ink; puzzles in decorative layouts added in ink on front flyleaf by a later hand (f. 1r).

binding.p: Later leather, blind-stamped with central medallions; rebacked.

origin.p: Written in Egypt, dated A.H. 17 Rajab 720 (23 Aug. 1320; inscription on title page, f. 3r).

history.provenance: Formerly owned by Sayyid Maḥmūd bin Nāṣir (inscription in Maghribi hand recording purchase in Egypt in A.H. 1065 (1654-1655), f. 1r?).
Formerly in the library of the al-Zāwiyah al-Nāṣiriyah at Tamegroute, Morocco, founded by the Bin Nāṣir family in the 17th century (stamped seals, f. 2r, 3r).
Sold by Sam Fogg Ltd. (London) to Lawrence J. Schoenberg, Jul. 2007.
Deposit by Lawrence J. Schoenberg and Barbara Brizdle, 2012.
